articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: The round of peace talks in Istanbul lasted one hour and 40 minutes. Hours later, a Russian drone killed nine bus passengers in the Sumy region of northeastern Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia demanded Kyiv pull back troops before ceasefire, Ukrainian source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's airforce killed at least 58 Palestinians in new attacks on Gaza overnight, local health authorities said on Saturday, as the country appeared set to press ahead with a new ground offensive.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 58 Palestinians overnight

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Romanians vote on Sunday in a presidential election run-off that pits a hard-right eurosceptic against a centrist independent, and where the outcome could have implications for both the country's struggling economy and EU unity.
articles.title: Romanians vote in presidential run-off that could widen EU rifts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Europe is a long way from talking about deploying troops in Ukraine as all its efforts are currently focused on securing an unconditional ceasefire from Russia, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said on Saturday.
articles.title: Germany, Italy say Europe's leaders 'far from' talks on troop deployment in Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. embassy in Libya denied on Sunday a report that the U.S. government was working on a plan to relocate Palestinians from the Gaza Strip to Libya.
articles.title: US embassy in Tripoli denies report of planned relocation of Palestinians to Libya

articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: Britain is working with the U.S. to ensure a ceasefire between India and Pakistan endures and that "confidence-building measures" and dialogue take place, foreign minister David Lammy said on Saturday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Lammy says UK, US working to ensure enduring India-Pakistan ceasefire, dialogue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syrian security forces raided Islamic State hideouts in Aleppo on Saturday, killing at least one militant and arresting others, authorities said, the first time the Islamist-led government has announced such an operation in Syria's second city.
articles.title: Syrian government forces raid Islamic State hideouts in Aleppo

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: The first high-level talks between Russia and Ukraine since the early months of Moscow's 2022 invasion showed they are far from agreement on steps needed for a ceasefire, even though they promised a major swap of prisoners of war.
articles.title: Istanbul peace talks lay bare chasm between Ukraine and Russia

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Sandra Palleiro is on the hunt for her lost cows. The 60-year-old accountant is standing in a muddy field at the end of a farm track in Uruguay's remote border region with Brazil.
articles.title: Phantom cows and missing millions spark scandal in Uruguay

articles.author: Ahmed Elumami
articles.description: Libyan Prime Minister Abdulhamid al-Dbeibah said on Saturday that eliminating militias is an "ongoing project," as a ceasefire after deadly clashes this week remained in place.
articles.title: Libya's PM says eliminating militias is 'ongoing project' as ceasefire holds
